required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Comparative Study of the Tolerability of Two Combination Therapies for the Treatment of Acne
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-blind, Randomized, Comparative Pilot Study Evaluating the Tolerability of Two Topical Combination Therapies in the Treatment of Acne Vulgaris

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the tolerability of topical combination therapies in the treatment of facial acne.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the tolerability of topical combination therapies in the treatment of facial acne.

primary_outcome.description: Signs and symptoms of tolerability (erythema, peeling, dryness, and irritant/allergic contact dermatitis)on the face. Erythema, peeling, dryness, and irritant/allergic contact dermatitis were graded using the following scale: 0, None; 1, Slight; 2, Moderate; 3, Intense.

Signs and symptoms of tolerability (erythema, peeling, dryness, and irritant/allergic contact dermatitis)on the face. Erythema, peeling, dryness, and irritant/allergic contact dermatitis were graded using the following scale: 0, None; 1, Slight; 2, Moderate; 3, Intense.

Signs and symptoms of tolerability (erythema, peeling, dryness, and irritant/allergic contact dermatitis)on the face. Erythema, peeling, dryness, and irritant/allergic contact dermatitis were graded using the following scale: 0, None; 1, Slight; 2, Moderate; 3,Intense.

Signs and symptoms of tolerability (erythema, peeling, dryness, and irritant/allergic contact dermatitis)on the face. Erythema, peeling, dryness, and irritant/allergic contact dermatitis were graded using the following scale: 0, None; 1, Slight; 2, Moderate; 3, Intense.

secondary_outcome.measure: Erythema (Redness)
secondary_outcome.description: Signs and symptoms of tolerability (erythema, peeling, dryness, and irritant/allergic contact dermatitis)on the face. Erythema, peeling, dryness, and irritant/allergic contact dermatitis were graded using the following scale: 0, None; 1, Slight; 2, Moderate; 3, Intense.

secondary_outcome.measure: Skin Dryness
secondary_outcome.description: Signs and symptoms of tolerability (erythema, peeling, dryness, and irritant/allergic contact dermatitis)on the face. Erythema, peeling, dryness, and irritant/allergic contact dermatitis were graded using the following scale: 0, None; 1, Slight; 2, Moderate; 3, Intense.

secondary_outcome.measure: Skin Peeling
secondary_outcome.description: Signs and symptoms of tolerability (erythema, peeling, dryness, and irritant/allergic contact dermatitis)on the face. Erythema, peeling, dryness, and irritant/allergic contact dermatitis were graded using the following scale: 0, None; 1, Slight; 2, Moderate; 3, Intense.

secondary_outcome.measure: Irritant/Allergic Contact Dermatitis
secondary_outcome.description: Signs and symptoms of tolerability (erythema, peeling, dryness, and irritant/allergic contact dermatitis)on the face. Erythema, peeling, dryness, and irritant/allergic contact dermatitis were graded using the following scale: 0, None; 1, Slight; 2, Moderate; 3, Intense.

secondary_outcome.measure: Investigators Static Global Assessment
secondary_outcome.description: ISGA is evaluated using the following scale: 0, Clear: Clear skin with no lesions; 1, Almost Clear: Rare non-inflammatory lesions; 2, Mild: Some non-inflammatory lesions with no more than a few inflammatory lesions but no nodular lesions); 3, Moderate: Up to many non-inflammatory lesions and may have some inflammatory lesions, but no more than 1 small nodular lesion; 4, Severe: Up to many non-inflammatory and inflammatory lesions, but no more than a few nodular lesions; 5, Very Severe: Many non-inflammatory and inflammatory lesions and more than a few nodular lesions. May have cystic lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Acne Lesion Counts
secondary_outcome.description: Total acne lesion counts - includes both inflammatory acne lesions (pustules, papules), noninflammatory lesions (whiteheads and blackheads),

secondary_outcome.measure: Inflammatory Acne Lesion Counts
secondary_outcome.description: Total number of inflammatory acne lesions (pustules, papules) at each timepoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: Non-inflammatory Acne Lesion Counts
secondary_outcome.description: Total number of non-inflammatory acne lesions (whiteheads and blackheads) at each timepoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: Skindex-29 Quality of Life Questionnaire (QoL) - Symptomatic Domain
secondary_outcome.description: Skindex-29 is a self-administered (by participants at each time point) QoL questionnaire comprised of 29 items (it.) scored on a 5-point scale (0=never, 1=rarely, 2=sometimes, 3=often, 4=all the time) covering 3 domains: emotional (10 it.); symptomatic (7 it.); functional (12 it.). Domain scores range from 0 to 40, 0 to 28, and 0 to 48, respectively. Lower scores=better QoL. The symptomatic score (score=0 to 28)=(sum of the 7 individual item scores) * 100/28.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life Questionnaire - Emotional Domain
secondary_outcome.description: Skindex-29 is a self-administered (by participants at each time point) QoL questionnaire comprised of 29 items (it.) scored on a 5-point scale (0=never, 1=rarely, 2=sometimes, 3=often, 4=all the time) covering 3 domains: emotional (10 it.); symptomatic (7 it.); functional (12 it.). Domain scores range from 0 to 40, 0 to 28, and 0 to 48, respectively. Lower scores=better QoL. The emotional score (score=0 to 40)=(sum of the 10 individual item scores) * 100/40.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life Questionnaire - Functional Domain
secondary_outcome.description: Skindex-29 is a self-administered (by participants at each time point) QoL questionnaire comprised of 29 items (it.) scored on a 5-point scale (0=never, 1=rarely, 2=sometimes, 3=often, 4=all the time) covering 3 domains: emotional (10 it.); symptomatic (7 it.); functional (12 it.). Domain scores range from 0 to 40, 0 to 28, and 0 to 48, respectively. Lower scores=better QoL. The functional score (score=0 to 48)=(sum of the 12 individual item scores) * 100/48.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life Questionnaire - Global Score
secondary_outcome.description: Skindex-29 is a self-administered (by participants at each time point) QoL questionnaire comprised of 29 items (it.) scored on a 5-point scale (0=never, 1=rarely, 2=sometimes, 3=often, 4=all the time) covering 3 domains: emotional (10 it.); symptomatic (7 it.); functional (12 it.). Domain scores range from 0 to 40, 0 to 28, and 0 to 48, respectively. Lower scores=better QoL. A Global Score (range 0-100)=(sum of all 29 individual item scores) * 100/116.

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Severity of Redness at Weeks 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire were completed by the subject at each timepoint using the following scale: 0, None; 1, Very minimal; 2, Mild; 3, Moderate; 4, Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Severity of Redness at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire was completed by the subject at week 8 using the following scale: 0, None; 1, Very minimal; 2, Mild; 3, Moderate; 4, Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Severity of Dryness at Weeks 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire were completed by the subject at each timepoint using the following scale: 0, None; 1, Very minimal; 2, Mild; 3, Moderate; 4, Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Severity of Dryness at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire was completed by the subject at week 8 using the following scale: 0, None; 1, Very minimal; 2, Mild; 3, Moderate; 4, Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Severity of Burning at Weeks 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire were completed by the subject at each timepoint using the following scale: 0, None; 1, Very minimal; 2, Mild; 3, Moderate; 4, Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Severity of Burning at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire was completed by the subject at week 8 using the following scale: 0, None; 1, Very minimal; 2, Mild; 3, Moderate; 4, Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Severity of Itching at Weeks 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire were completed by the subject at each timepoint using the following scale: 0, None; 1, Very minimal; 2, Mild; 3, Moderate; 4, Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Severity of Itching at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire was completed by the subject at week 8 using the following scale: 0, None; 1, Very minimal; 2, Mild; 3, Moderate; 4, Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Severity of Scaling at Weeks 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire were completed by the subject at each timepoint using the following scale: 0, None; 1, Very minimal; 2, Mild; 3, Moderate; 4, Severe; 5, Very Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Severity of Scaling at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire was completed by the subject at week 8 using the following scale: 0, None; 1, Very minimal; 2, Mild; 3, Moderate; 4, Severe; 5, Very Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Ease of Application of Product at Weeks 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire were completed by the subject at each timepoint using the following scale: 1, Very easy; 2, Easy; 3, Neutral; 4, Difficult.

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Ease of Application of Product at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire was completed by the subject at week 8 using the following scale: 1, Very easy; 2, Easy; 3, Neutral; 4, Difficult.

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Comfort of Skin at Weeks 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire were completed by the subject at each timepoint using the following scale: 1, Very Comfortable; 2, Comfortable; 3, Somewhat Comfortable; 4, Somewhat Uncomfortable; 5, Uncomfortable.

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Comfort of Skin at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire were completed by the subject at each timepoint using the following scale: 1, Very Comfortable; 2, Comfortable; 3, Somewhat Comfortable; 4, Somewhat Uncomfortable; 5, Uncomfortable.

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Which Study Product is Subject More Satisfied With? at Weeks 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire were completed by the subject at each timepoint using the following choices: Epiduo, Clindoxyl Gel, Both Treatments Equally.

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Comparison of Study Products Used in the Past at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire was completed by the subject at week 8 using the following scale: 1, More Satisfied; 2, Somewhat More Satisfied; 3, Neither Satisfied or Dissatisfied; 4, Somewhat More Dissatisfied; 5, More Dissatisfied.

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Decrease of Acne Breakouts by Study Products at Weeks 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire were completed by the subject at each timepoint using the following scale: 1, Highly Favorable; 2, Favorable; 3, Neutral; 4, Unfavorable; 5, Uncomfortable.

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Decrease of Acne Breakouts by Study Products at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire was completed by the subject at week 8 using the following scale: 1, Highly Favorable; 2, Favorable; 3, Neutral; 4, Unfavorable; 5, More Dissatisfied.

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Compliance at Weeks 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire were completed by the subject at each timepoint using the following scale: 0, Not Compliant at all; 1, Mostly Compliant; 2, Very Compliant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Compliance at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire were completed by the subject at week 8 by answering Yes or No to the following question: Did you use the product every day?. When only one product was applied to the face, subjects were asked to rate their compliance by answering the aforementioned question, rather than rating compliance on a 0-2 scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Feeling of Hydrated and Moisturized Skin at Weeks 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire were completed by the subject at each timepoint by answering Yes or No to the following question: Did you feel that your skin was hydrated and moisturized while you were on your study product?

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Feeling of Hydrated and Moisturized Skin at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire were completed by the subject at each timepoint by answering Yes or No to the following question: Did you feel that your skin was hydrated and moisturized while you were on your study product?

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Use of Study Product if Choice to Continue Acne Treatment at Week 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire were completed by the subject at each timepoint by answering Yes or No to the following question: If you were to choose to continue treatment for your acne, would you use the study product?

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Use of Study Product if Choice to Continue Acne Treatment at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire were completed by the subject at 8 week timepoint by answering Yes or No to the following question: If you were to choose to continue treatment for your acne, would you use the study product?

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Ease of Use Wtih Make-Up at Weeks 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire were completed by the subject at each timepoint using the following scale: 0, Not Applicable; 1, Very Easy; 2, Easy; 3, Neutral; 4, Difficult; 5, Very Difficult.

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Ease of Use With Make-Up at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire were completed by the subject at each timepoint using the following scale: 0, Not Applicable; 1, Very Easy; 2, Easy; 3, Neutral; 4, Difficult; 5, Very Difficult.

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Overall Satisfaction of Study Product at Weeks 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire were completed by the subject at each timepoint using the following scale: 1, Very Satisfied; 2, Satisfied; 3, Neutral; 4, Unsatisfied; 5, Very Unsatisfied.

secondary_outcome.measure: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Overall Satisfaction of Study Product at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire were completed by the subject at each timepoint using the following scale: 1, Very Satisfied; 2, Satisfied; 3, Neutral; 4, Unsatisfied; 5, Very Unsatisfied.

arm_group.description: Subject will apply both study products in a split-face fashion. Study products will be applied once-daily in the evening.
Subject will apply both study products in a split-face fashion. Study products will be applied once-daily in the evening.

intervention.description: Commencing at baseline, subjects will apply once daily both treatment arm #1 and treatment arm #2 in a bilateral split-face fashion (allocation to left and right side randomly assigned) for an initial 2 weeks. At 2 weeks, subjects will apply benzoyl peroxide/clindamycin gel to the entire face for an additional 6 weeks.

Commencing at baseline, subjects will apply once daily both treatment arm #1 and treatment arm #2 in a bilateral split-face fashion (allocation to left and right side randomly assigned) for an initial 2 weeks. At 2 weeks, subjects will apply benzoyl peroxide/clindamycin gel to the entire face for an additional 6 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female subjects at least 21 years of age, in good general health with documented diagnosis of acne vulgaris.
- Female subjects of childbearing potential must have a negative pregnancy test. Sexually active women of childbearing potential participating in the study must use a medically acceptable form of contraception Abstinence is considered an acceptable method of contraception.
- Inflammatory (papules and pustules) and non-inflammatory (open and closed comedones) facial lesions.
- The ability and willingness to follow all study procedures, attend all scheduled visits, and successfully complete the study
- Capable of understanding and willing to provide signed and dated written voluntary informed consent (and any local or national authorization requirements) before any protocol specific procedures are performed
Exclusion Criteria:
- Female subjects who are pregnant, trying to become pregnant or breastfeeding.
- Subjects who have any clinically relevant finding at their baseline physical other than acne vulgaris.
- History or presence of regional enteritis or inflammatory bowel disease (eg, ulcerative colitis, pseudomembranous colitis, chronic diarrhea, or a history of antibiotic-associated colitis) or similar symptoms.
- Use of topical antibiotics or anti-acne medications on the face and systemic antibiotics within the past 2 and 4 weeks, respectively.
- Use of topical corticosteroids on the face or systemic corticosteroids within the past 4 weeks. Use of inhaled, intra-articular or intra-lesional (other than for facial acne lesions) steroids is acceptable.
- Use of systemic retinoids within the past 6 months.
- Facial procedures performed by an esthetician, beautician, physician, nurse, or other practitioner, within the past 4 weeks or during the conduct of the study.
- Known hypersensitivity or previous allergic reaction to any of the active components, lincomycin, adapalene, clindamycin, benzoyl peroxide or excipients of the study product.

facility.name: Centro de Investigación y Prevencion de Enfermidades Cardiovasculares

link.description: Researchers can use this site to request access to anonymised patient level data and/or supporting documents from clinical studies to conduct further research.

patient_data.ipd_description: Patient-level data for this study will be made available through www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com following the timelines and process described on this site.

group.title: Clindoxyl and Epiduo Gels
group.description: Commencing at baseline, participants will apply clindoxyl and epiduo gels once daily in a bilateral split-face fashion (Split Face Treatment Period; allocation to left and right side randomly assigned) for an initial 2 weeks. At Week 5, during the Full Face Treatment Period, participants will apply clindoxyl gel to the entire face for an additional 4 weeks.

group.title: Clindoxyl and Epiduo Gels
group.description: Commencing at baseline, participants will apply clindoxyl and epiduo gels once daily in a bilateral split-face fashion (Split Face Treatment Period; allocation to left and right side randomly assigned) for an initial 2 weeks. At Week 5, during the Full Face Treatment Period, participants will apply clindoxyl gel to the entire face for an additional 4 weeks.

measure.title: Age
Gender
Ethnicity (NIH/OMB)
Race (NIH/OMB)

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Region of Enrollment
Investigators Static Global Assessment (ISGA)
measure.description: The investigator rated the participants’ skin using the 6-point ISGA: 0=clear, clear skin with no inflammatory lesions (ILs) or non-ILs; 1=almost clear, rare non-ILs with no more than one small IL; 2=mild, some non-ILs with no more than a few ILs (papules/pustules only, no nodular lesions [NLs]); 3=moderate, up to many non-ILs and may have some ILs, but no more than one small NL; 4=severe, up to many non-IL and ILs, but no more than a few NLs; 5=many non-IL and ILs and more than a few NLs. May have cystic lesions. Participants with grades of 2-4 were eligible for enrollment in this study.

measure.title: Inflammatory Acne Lesion Count
measure.description: Inflammatory acne lesion count at baseline (number of pustules and papules).

measure.title: Non-Inflammatory Acne Lesion Count
measure.description: Non-Inflammatory acne lesion count at baseline (number of whiteheads and blackheads)

measure.title: Total Acne Lesion Count
measure.description: Total acne lesion count (includes inflammatory and non-inflammatory lesions)

outcome.title: Erythema (Redness)
outcome.description: Signs and symptoms of tolerability (erythema, peeling, dryness, and irritant/allergic contact dermatitis)on the face. Erythema, peeling, dryness, and irritant/allergic contact dermatitis were graded using the following scale: 0, None; 1, Slight; 2, Moderate; 3, Intense.

group.title: Clindoxyl Gel
group.description: Clindoxyl gel was applied to one side of the face in a randomized fashion. This study product was applied once-daily in the evening.

group.title: Epiduo Gel
group.description: Epiduo gel was applied to one side of the face in a randomized fashion. This study product was applied once-daily in the evening.

outcome.title: Investigators Static Global Assessment
outcome.description: ISGA is evaluated using the following scale: 0, Clear: Clear skin with no lesions; 1, Almost Clear: Rare non-inflammatory lesions; 2, Mild: Some non-inflammatory lesions with no more than a few inflammatory lesions but no nodular lesions); 3, Moderate: Up to many non-inflammatory lesions and may have some inflammatory lesions, but no more than 1 small nodular lesion; 4, Severe: Up to many non-inflammatory and inflammatory lesions, but no more than a few nodular lesions; 5, Very Severe: Many non-inflammatory and inflammatory lesions and more than a few nodular lesions. May have cystic lesions.
outcome.population: For the first 2 weeks, participants apply one of the drugs (Clindoxyl or Epiduo) to one side of the face and the other drug to the other side of their face. After week 2, participants apply Clindoxyl to their entire face and do not use Epiduo.

measure.title: Non-inflammatory Acne Lesion Counts

outcome.title: Skindex-29 Quality of Life Questionnaire (QoL) - Symptomatic Domain
outcome.description: Skindex-29 is a self-administered (by participants at each time point) QoL questionnaire comprised of 29 items (it.) scored on a 5-point scale (0=never, 1=rarely, 2=sometimes, 3=often, 4=all the time) covering 3 domains: emotional (10 it.); symptomatic (7 it.); functional (12 it.). Domain scores range from 0 to 40, 0 to 28, and 0 to 48, respectively. Lower scores=better QoL. The symptomatic score (score=0 to 28)=(sum of the 7 individual item scores) * 100/28.

group.title: Clindoxyl Gel
group.description: Subjects applied Clindoxyl gel to their entire face once-daily in the evening.

measure.title: Skindex-29 Quality of Life Questionnaire (QoL) - Symptomatic Domain
measure.description: Skindex-29 is a self-administered (by participants at each time point) QoL questionnaire comprised of 29 items (it.) scored on a 5-point scale (0=never, 1=rarely, 2=sometimes, 3=often, 4=all the time) covering 3 domains: emotional (10 it.); symptomatic (7 it.); functional (12 it.). Domain scores range from 0 to 40, 0 to 28, and 0 to 48, respectively. Lower scores=better QoL. The symptomatic score (score=0 to 28)=(sum of the 7 individual item scores) * 100/28.

measure.title: Quality of Life Questionnaire - Emotional Domain
measure.description: Skindex-29 is a self-administered (by participants at each time point) QoL questionnaire comprised of 29 items (it.) scored on a 5-point scale (0=never, 1=rarely, 2=sometimes, 3=often, 4=all the time) covering 3 domains: emotional (10 it.); symptomatic (7 it.); functional (12 it.). Domain scores range from 0 to 40, 0 to 28, and 0 to 48, respectively. Lower scores=better QoL. The emotional score (score=0 to 40)=(sum of the 10 individual item scores) * 100/40.

outcome.title: Quality of Life Questionnaire - Functional Domain
outcome.description: Skindex-29 is a self-administered (by participants at each time point) QoL questionnaire comprised of 29 items (it.) scored on a 5-point scale (0=never, 1=rarely, 2=sometimes, 3=often, 4=all the time) covering 3 domains: emotional (10 it.); symptomatic (7 it.); functional (12 it.). Domain scores range from 0 to 40, 0 to 28, and 0 to 48, respectively. Lower scores=better QoL. The functional score (score=0 to 48)=(sum of the 12 individual item scores) * 100/48.

group.title: Clindoxyl Gel
group.description: Subjects applied Clindoxyl gel to their entire face once-daily in the evening.

measure.title: Quality of Life Questionnaire - Functional Domain
measure.description: Skindex-29 is a self-administered (by participants at each time point) QoL questionnaire comprised of 29 items (it.) scored on a 5-point scale (0=never, 1=rarely, 2=sometimes, 3=often, 4=all the time) covering 3 domains: emotional (10 it.); symptomatic (7 it.); functional (12 it.). Domain scores range from 0 to 40, 0 to 28, and 0 to 48, respectively. Lower scores=better QoL. The functional score (score=0 to 48)=(sum of the 12 individual item scores) * 100/48.

outcome.title: Quality of Life Questionnaire - Global Score
outcome.description: Skindex-29 is a self-administered (by participants at each time point) QoL questionnaire comprised of 29 items (it.) scored on a 5-point scale (0=never, 1=rarely, 2=sometimes, 3=often, 4=all the time) covering 3 domains: emotional (10 it.); symptomatic (7 it.); functional (12 it.). Domain scores range from 0 to 40, 0 to 28, and 0 to 48, respectively. Lower scores=better QoL. A Global Score (range 0-100)=(sum of all 29 individual item scores) * 100/116.

group.title: Clindoxyl Gel
group.description: Subjects applied Clindoxyl gel to their entire face once-daily in the evening.

measure.title: Quality of Life Questionnaire - Global Score

Domain scores range from 0 to 40, 0 to 28, and 0 to 48, respectively. Lower scores=better QoL. A Global Score (range 0-100)=(sum of all 29 individual item scores) * 100/116.

outcome.title: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire - Compliance at Week 8
outcome.description: Product Acceptability and Preference Questionnaire were completed by the subject at week 8 by answering Yes or No to the following question: Did you use the product every day?. reported_events.desc: Any study product-related AEs ongoing at the end of the treatment period will be followed until they resolve, the condition stabilizes, the events are otherwise explained, or the subject is lost to follow-up. In addition, all SAEs will be followed until resolution as previously stated for study product-related AEs.

group.title: Clindoxyl and Epiduo Gels
group.description: Commencing at baseline, participants will apply clindoxyl and epiduo gels once daily in a bilateral split-face fashion (Split Face Treatment Period; allocation to left and right side randomly assigned) for an initial 2 weeks. At Week 5, during the Full Face Treatment Period, participants will apply clindoxyl gel to the entire face for an additional 4 weeks.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If the Investigator wishes to make any such publication or presentation, the Investigator must first submit such publication or presentation to Stiefel for review at least thirty (30) days prior to the date on which such publication or presentation is proposed to be made.
